title: Lavender Villa / Be4 Architecture
description: Nestled along the serene Co Co River, Lavender Villa stands as a gentle extension of Da Nang's coastal landscape. Designed with a philosophy of environmental integration, the villa does not resist its natural surroundings but embraces them, becoming a living entity that breathes with sun, rain, and river wind typical of Central Vietnam's climate.
author: Miwa Negoro

title: Center Coffee Eastpole / KKOL Studio
description: Center Coffee is a brand known and loved for its devotion to coffee beans and its sincerity toward coffee. Alongside a change in seasons, Center Coffee underwent a large-scale rebranding and a simultaneous recontextualization of its spatial design. Each location has its unique appeal and characteristics, but there was a need to form an appropriate level of visual consistency throughout. The task was to forge "uniformity" while also specifying a degree of "difference."
author: Valeria Silva

title: Inside a Japanese-Inspired Vineyard Home in Turkey
description: In an episode of Özlem Discovery, a YouTube channel known for unique home tours, viewers are introduced to a secluded vineyard house tucked away on a one-acre plot in the tranquil hills of Sapanca, Turkey. Designed with strong influences from Japanese architecture, the home offers a bold and refreshing take on vacation living, unlike anything typically seen in the region.
author: Erin

title: The Horizon Shapes Every Room Inside This Apartment
description: Overlooking Boa Viagem Beach in Recife, Brazil, this apartment by Architects Office was redesigned to bring the ocean and sky into every corner. Guided by the concept of the horizon, the layout was reworked to expand views and blur the boundary between interior and exterior. The result is a space where structure, materials, and flow center on openness and calm.
author: Erin

title: Porsche and Norman Foster Are Building Bridges Inspired by Dreams
description: Gateway to Venice's Waterway is a dynamic aluminum bridge leaping over water by Porsche and Norman Foster that inspires a new wave of mobility.
